predictionResults.historyEmpty: No historical data found. Run a prediction to populate summary.
predictionResults.noDataHint: Upload or capture an image and run prediction to see results

status.ready: Image is ready. You can run prediction now.
status.prompt: Upload or capture an image to enable prediction.

buttons.runPredictionNeedImage: Please upload or capture an image first

calibration.requireImage: Please upload or capture an image before calibrating

instructions.line1: • Drag the blue corner handles to resize the bounding box.
instructions.line2: • Drag the blue handles on vertical lines (13 lines) to adjust column positions.
instructions.line3: • Drag the blue handles on horizontal lines (9 lines) to adjust row positions.
instructions.line4: • Line order is locked from left→right and top→bottom automatically.

calibration.tip: Tip: Zoom the browser or drag lines along the inner edge of each well for best accuracy, then press “Save Calibration”.
calibration.infoHint: Drag the 8x12 grid to cover every well. The outer frame should align with the microplate border so predictions stay aligned.
calibration.infoMessageDefault: Drag the corners and grid lines to match the microplate, then press “Save Calibration”.

status.boundsAdjusted: Adjusted grid bounds. Remember to press “Save Calibration”.
status.columnsAdjusted: Adjusted vertical lines. Remember to press “Save Calibration”.
status.rowsAdjusted: Adjusted horizontal lines. Remember to press “Save Calibration”.
status.saveSuccess: Calibration saved successfully. Future captures will use this grid.
status.saveInvalid: Please adjust the frame and grid lines before saving.
status.cleared: Calibration reset. Future images will use the default grid.

resultsPanel.pressEnter: Press Enter to load sample results
resultsPanel.historyEmpty: No recent scans in this session

userGuide.title: User Guide
userGuide.subtitle: Detailed instructions for using the HAllytics system

guideSections.title: HAllytics System Overview
guideSections.description: AI-powered microplate analytics for quality and quantity assessment
steps: AI models analyze microplate images automatically
Upload or capture images directly from connected cameras
View analysis results in intuitive tables and charts
Generate interface files for labware systems
Manage samples and historical predictions
Monitor camera connection status in real time
tips: Ensure images are sharp and evenly lit
Position the microplate correctly under the camera
Fill in sample metadata before running predictions

guideSections.title: Dashboard
guideSections.description: Upload images and start new predictions
steps: Enter the Submission Number (required)
Enter the Test Number (required)
Enter the Plate No. (optional)
Scan a QR code or input data manually
Upload or capture a microplate image
Check camera status before capturing
Press "Capture" to take a new image
Press "Run Prediction" to start analysis
tips: Use the QR code scanner for accuracy and speed
Ensure the camera status shows ready before capturing
Review your inputs before running predictions
Wait for the analysis to complete before leaving the page
Refresh the camera status if it appears offline
warnings: Submission Number and Test Number are required
Only upload supported image formats (JPG, PNG, etc.)
Confirm the camera is connected and ready
Contact the administrator if the camera fails repeatedly

guideSections.title: Results
guideSections.description: Inspect detailed prediction outcomes and statistics
steps: Select a sample to review results
Review the overall distribution summary
Inspect individual analysis runs
Compare original and annotated images
Generate labware interface files
Download CSV summaries
tips: Click images to view them in full size
Use the interface button to generate CSV files
Verify totals in each summary table

guideSections.title: Camera Status
steps: Watch the system logs bar for camera updates
Check the status indicator beside Capture
Refresh the connection if the status is stale
Note the timestamp of the last health check
Review status messages for guidance
tips: "Camera Ready" means you can capture immediately
"Camera Unavailable" means you should verify connections
"Capturing..." indicates the camera is in progress
"Checking..." shows the system is validating the connection
warnings: If the camera is offline, inspect the Vision Capture Service
Do not close the browser while capturing
Contact support if connectivity issues persist

guideSections.title: Notifications
steps: Open the bell icon to view notifications
Click a notification for full details
Mark items as read when reviewed
Remove notifications you no longer need
Use "View all" for the full history
tips: Red badges show unread notifications
Green indicators signal success
Yellow indicators highlight warnings
Red indicators flag errors

guideSections.title: Profile
guideSections.description: Manage personal information and account settings
steps: Review your profile details
Update personal information
Change your password regularly
Adjust account preferences
tips: Keep your profile information current
Use strong, unique passwords
Monitor your email for important updates

guideSections.title: Settings
steps: Switch between light, dark, and system themes
Choose your preferred language
Configure notification preferences
Fine-tune additional system settings
tips: Pick a theme that matches your environment
Balance notification volume with your workflow
Save your changes to apply them

troubleshooting.title: Common issues and how to fix them

sections.title: Image not displaying
sections.description: If results images fail to render
items: Verify the uploaded image is valid

sections.title: Prediction takes too long
items: Allow the system to finish processing

sections.title: Unable to download CSV
sections.description: If interface CSV files fail to download

sections.title: Incorrect data
items: Verify the inputs on the dashboard

sections.title: Camera unavailable
sections.description: If the camera shows unavailable or checking
items: Inspect the camera connection to the system
Confirm the Vision Capture Service is running
Use file upload as a fallback
Contact support if the issue persists

sections.title: Capture button disabled
sections.description: If the capture button stays greyed out
items: Confirm the camera status is ready
Wait for the connection check to complete
Make sure Sample and Submission numbers are filled

cta.title: Need more help?
cta.description: If you cannot resolve the issue, please contact our support team.
